keyword: how many calories in pulled pork
title: How Many Calories in Pulled Pork?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in pulled pork per 100g, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and serving tweaks for BBQ or lean versions.
h1: How Many Calories in Pulled Pork?
assumptions: Slow-cooked pork shoulder, shredded, lean with some fat, no added sauce, salt, or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, cooking method, fat content, added sauces, and brand; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100g of pulled pork provides ~240 kcal and ~25g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g pulled pork?
faqs.a: About 240 kcal for plain cooked pulled pork.

faqs.q: Is pulled pork high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, ~25g protein per 100g, making it a good lean meat option.

faqs.q: How does BBQ sauce affect calories in pulled pork?
faqs.a: Adds ~50 kcal per 2 tbsp due to sugars and carbs.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in pulled pork?
Does cooking method change pulled pork calories?
faqs.a: Yesâ€”smoked or braised may vary by 20-50 kcal; fat trimming lowers them.
